data: 1 00:01:48,520 --> 00:01:50,272 Bingo. 2 00:02:04,000 --> 00:02:05,797 Fucking hell. 3 00:02:07,960 --> 00:02:09,837 Fucking hell. 4 00:02:57,920 --> 00:03:00,480 - Oh, God. - Keep your shit together. 5 00:03:00,560 --> 00:03:03,518 lf you wanna get 'em out of here. 6 00:03:04,320 --> 00:03:06,880 - l can pop these, no problem. - So get to it. 7 00:03:20,520 --> 00:03:22,909 Security, we have a break-in... 8 00:03:31,040 --> 00:03:33,759 l know who you are. l know what you think... 9 00:03:33,840 --> 00:03:37,515 lf you don't wanna get hurt, keep your mouth shut and don't move. 10 00:03:37,600 --> 00:03:42,628 The chimps are infected. They're highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor. 11 00:03:42,720 --> 00:03:46,030 - lnfected with what? - To cure, you must first understand. 12 00:03:46,120 --> 00:03:48,953 lnfected with what? 13 00:03:50,840 --> 00:03:52,637 Rage. 14 00:03:54,280 --> 00:03:57,317 - What is he talking about? - Get the cages open. 15 00:03:59,360 --> 00:04:03,478 Listen, you sick bastard, we're taking your torture victims with us. 16 00:04:03,560 --> 00:04:05,073 We'll get you out of here. 17 00:04:05,160 --> 00:04:09,631 The animals are contagious. The infection is in their blood and saliva. One bite... 18 00:04:09,720 --> 00:04:12,109 Stop... Stop! You've no idea. 19 00:04:18,400 --> 00:04:21,119 Get it off. Help me! 20 00:04:26,280 --> 00:04:28,316 Get it off! Get it off! 21 00:04:31,800 --> 00:04:34,872 - What's the matter with her? - You have to kill her. 22 00:04:36,880 --> 00:04:39,030 Oh, my God. 23 00:04:43,200 --> 00:04:46,272 - What's the matter with her? - We have to kill her now. 24 00:06:34,720 --> 00:06:36,153 Hello? 25 00:07:13,040 --> 00:07:14,473 Hello? 26 00:07:31,880 --> 00:07:33,791 Hello. 27 00:09:11,560 --> 00:09:12,834 Hello? 28 00:09:38,080 --> 00:09:39,513 Hello. 29 00:14:19,880 --> 00:14:21,871 Hello? 30 00:14:29,560 --> 00:14:31,551 Hello? 31 00:14:45,320 --> 00:14:47,311 Father? 32 00:14:53,480 --> 00:14:55,471 Father, are you OK? 33 00:15:02,520 --> 00:15:05,080 Shouldn't have done that. 34 00:15:05,480 --> 00:15:07,630 Shouldn't have done that. 35 00:15:08,040 --> 00:15:09,837 Shit. 36 00:15:35,520 --> 00:15:37,556 Over here. 37 00:15:40,320 --> 00:15:42,550 - Over here. - Come on. 38 00:15:54,520 --> 00:15:56,875 Go, go, go. 39 00:16:01,920 --> 00:16:02,955 Keep going. 40 00:16:03,040 --> 00:16:05,793 - What the fuck is going on? - Just shut up. 41 00:16:13,600 --> 00:16:16,068 - Covered everything. - Who are those people? 42 00:16:42,280 --> 00:16:45,716 - Let's go. Let's go. - What the fuck is going on? 43 00:16:54,160 --> 00:16:56,071 Come on. 44 00:17:14,480 --> 00:17:19,031 Man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. 45 00:17:19,120 --> 00:17:21,031 The giraffe falls over. 46 00:17:21,120 --> 00:17:26,114 The man goes to leave and the barman says ''You can't leave that lying there.'' 47 00:17:26,200 --> 00:17:30,079 He says ''lt's not a lion. lt's a giraffe''. 48 00:17:37,400 --> 00:17:40,153 He's completely humourless. 49 00:17:40,240 --> 00:17:43,038 You two should get on like a house on fire. 50 00:17:44,480 --> 00:17:46,471 So who are you? 51 00:17:47,640 --> 00:17:49,471 You're from the hospital. 52 00:17:49,560 --> 00:17:52,916 - Are you a doctor? - He's not a doctor. He's a patient. 53 00:17:53,000 --> 00:17:55,230 l'm a bicycle courier. 54 00:17:57,320 --> 00:18:03,475 l was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me. 55 00:18:03,560 --> 00:18:09,078 Then l wake up today in hospital. l wake up and l'm hallucinating. 56 00:18:10,680 --> 00:18:13,035 What's your name? 57 00:18:13,120 --> 00:18:15,111 Jim. 58 00:18:15,760 --> 00:18:18,320 l'm Mark. This is Selena. 59 00:18:22,560 --> 00:18:24,152 OK, Jim. 60 00:18:29,160 --> 00:18:31,594 l've got some bad news. 61 00:18:31,680 --> 00:18:37,676 lt started as rioting, and right from the beginning you knew this was different. 62 00:18:37,760 --> 00:18:41,753 Because it was happening in small villages, market towns. 63 00:18:42,600 --> 00:18:45,239 And then it wasn't on the TV any more. 64 00:18:45,320 --> 00:18:49,836 lt was in the street outside. lt was coming through your windows. 65 00:18:49,920 --> 00:18:51,672 lt was a virus. 66 00:18:51,760 --> 00:18:53,478 An infection. 67 00:18:53,560 --> 00:18:56,279 You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. 68 00:18:56,360 --> 00:18:58,715 lt was the blood. 69 00:18:58,800 --> 00:19:01,189 There was something in the blood. 70 00:19:02,600 --> 00:19:07,355 By the time they tried to evacuate the cities, it was already too late. 71 00:19:07,440 --> 00:19:10,238 The infection was everywhere. 72 00:19:10,320 --> 00:19:12,709 The army blockades were overrun. 73 00:19:14,200 --> 00:19:16,794 And that's when the exodus started. 74 00:19:18,120 --> 00:19:20,759 The day before broadcasting stopped, 75 00:19:20,840 --> 00:19:24,355 there were reports of lnfection in Paris and New York. 76 00:19:26,640 --> 00:19:29,438 We didn't hear anything more after that. 77 00:19:32,280 --> 00:19:35,113 - What's the government doing? - There's no government. 78 00:19:35,200 --> 00:19:37,555 Of course there's a government. 79 00:19:37,640 --> 00:19:41,553 There's always a government. They're in a bunker or a plane. 80 00:19:41,640 --> 00:19:45,758 No, there's no government, no police, no army. 81 00:19:47,160 --> 00:19:50,118 No TV, no radio, no electricity. 82 00:19:50,720 --> 00:19:54,713 You're the first uninfected person we've seen in six days. 83 00:19:55,520 --> 00:19:57,511 Where's your family? 84 00:19:58,400 --> 00:20:00,356 They're dead. Like Selena's. 85 00:20:00,440 --> 00:20:02,476 Yours will be dead too. 86 00:20:12,360 --> 00:20:16,194 l have to find them. They live in Deptford. l can walk it. 87 00:20:16,280 --> 00:20:18,748 You'll go and come back, yeah? 88 00:20:20,640 --> 00:20:22,790 You won't. 89 00:20:22,880 --> 00:20:25,758 No one ever comes back. 90 00:20:30,080 --> 00:20:32,071 So lesson one. 91 00:20:32,920 --> 00:20:37,152 You never go anywhere alone unless you've got no choice. 92 00:20:37,240 --> 00:20:39,470 Lesson two. 93 00:20:39,560 --> 00:20:43,473 Only travel during daylight. Unless you've got no choice. 94 00:20:45,440 --> 00:20:47,396 We'll take you tomorrow. 95 00:20:47,480 --> 00:20:50,916 We'll all go and find your dead parents together. 96 00:20:51,920 --> 00:20:53,319 Eat. 97 00:21:05,000 --> 00:21:08,037 lf you want her to slow down, you'll have to say. 98 00:21:33,840 --> 00:21:37,515 - lf there's anyone in there who... - l understand. 99 00:22:23,200 --> 00:22:24,474 Wait. 100 00:23:45,680 --> 00:23:49,468 They died peacefully. You should be grateful. 101 00:23:49,560 --> 00:23:51,869 l'm not grateful. 102 00:23:55,680 --> 00:23:59,992 My parents and my sister, we went to Paddington Station, 103 00:24:02,520 --> 00:24:07,640 hoping maybe we could get on a plane, maybe we could buy our way onto a plane. 104 00:24:08,240 --> 00:24:10,515 l remember my dad had all this cash, 105 00:24:10,600 --> 00:24:13,797 even though cash was completely useless. 106 00:24:15,280 --> 00:24:18,272 About 20,000 other people had the same idea. 107 00:24:20,680 --> 00:24:22,796 Crowd was surging. 108 00:24:23,600 --> 00:24:25,830 l lost my grip on my sister's hand. 109 00:24:27,920 --> 00:24:30,150 l remember the ground was soft. 110 00:24:32,040 --> 00:24:36,238 l looked down and l was standing on all these people. 111 00:24:36,320 --> 00:24:40,108 Like a carpet. People who had fallen and... 112 00:24:40,200 --> 00:24:43,988 Somewhere in the crowd there were lnfected. lt spread fast. 113 00:24:44,080 --> 00:24:47,277 No one could run. All you could do was climb. 114 00:24:48,840 --> 00:24:51,798 Climb over more people. So l did that. l climbed. 115 00:24:51,880 --> 00:24:54,155 And l got up on top of this kiosk. 116 00:24:56,360 --> 00:25:01,115 Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. 117 00:25:01,200 --> 00:25:04,909 Then l saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. 118 00:25:05,000 --> 00:25:06,877 My dad. 119 00:25:09,080 --> 00:25:11,071 His face... 120 00:25:14,600 --> 00:25:18,354 Selena's right. You should be grateful. 121 00:25:18,440 --> 00:25:23,389 We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight. 122 00:25:25,960 --> 00:25:28,679 My room's up at the top. You two can have that. 123 00:25:28,760 --> 00:25:31,957 We'll all sleep in the same room. lt's safer. 124 00:26:59,280 --> 00:27:01,271 - You're back. - Yeah. 125 00:27:07,400 --> 00:27:09,391 - How was it? - Fine. 126 00:27:10,440 --> 00:27:12,635 Give me a drink of that, will ya? 127 00:27:12,720 --> 00:27:14,711 lt's empty. 128 00:27:21,160 --> 00:27:23,151 l'll start working on them, then. 129 00:27:48,000 --> 00:27:49,991 lt's clear. 130 00:27:55,240 --> 00:27:58,073 - That's Mr Bridges. - Were you bitten? 131 00:27:58,160 --> 00:28:00,276 And his daughter. From four doors down. 132 00:28:00,360 --> 00:28:03,318 Were you bitten? 133 00:28:03,400 --> 00:28:06,233 Did any of the blood get in your mouth? 134 00:28:12,000 --> 00:28:13,672 Mark? 135 00:28:16,000 --> 00:28:17,638 Wait. 136 00:28:38,600 --> 00:28:40,716 Get that cleaned off. 137 00:28:42,520 --> 00:28:44,511 Do you have any clothes here? 138 00:28:47,480 --> 00:28:50,995 Then get them and get dressed. We have to leave now. 139 00:28:51,080 --> 00:28:54,595 More lnfected will be coming. They always do. 140 00:29:22,200 --> 00:29:25,078 How did you know? How did you know he was infected? 141 00:29:25,160 --> 00:29:28,914 - The blood. - There was blood on me. lt was on you. 142 00:29:29,000 --> 00:29:34,154 l didn't know he was infected. He knew. l could see it in his face. 143 00:29:34,240 --> 00:29:38,472 lf someone gets infected, you've about 20 seconds to kill them. 144 00:29:38,560 --> 00:29:43,475 lt might be your brother, your sister or your oldest friend. lt makes no difference. 145 00:29:43,560 --> 00:29:48,759 Just so you know where you stand, if it happens to you, l'll do it in a heartbeat. 146 00:29:48,840 --> 00:29:52,879 He was full of plans. Have you got any plans? 147 00:29:52,960 --> 00:29:57,238 Do you want us to find a cure and save the world orjust fall in love and fuck? 148 00:29:57,320 --> 00:29:59,709 Plans are pointless. 149 00:29:59,800 --> 00:30:02,268 Staying alive's as good as it gets. 150 00:30:05,480 --> 00:30:07,471 What's that? 151 00:30:13,320 --> 00:30:15,311 Let's go. 152 00:30:58,600 --> 00:31:01,592 What is it about tower blocks and shopping trolleys? 153 00:31:01,680 --> 00:31:04,638 Stop talking. lt's a long way up. 154 00:31:13,960 --> 00:31:16,190 Do you need a break? 155 00:31:17,360 --> 00:31:19,271 - You? - No. 156 00:31:21,840 --> 00:31:23,831 Now l do need a break. 157 00:31:33,880 --> 00:31:35,632 What's up? 158 00:31:35,720 --> 00:31:37,631 Nothin'. 159 00:31:39,920 --> 00:31:41,194 l got a headache. 160 00:31:41,280 --> 00:31:42,713 - Bad? - Pretty bad. 161 00:31:42,800 --> 00:31:47,874 - Why didn't you say something before? - l didn't think you'd give a shit. 162 00:31:49,040 --> 00:31:53,113 You've got no fat on you and all you've had to eat is sugar. 163 00:31:53,200 --> 00:31:55,236 So you're crashing. 164 00:31:55,320 --> 00:31:57,470 There isn't a lot we can do about that 165 00:31:57,560 --> 00:32:02,429 except pump you full of painkillers and give you more sugar. As for sugar, 166 00:32:02,520 --> 00:32:04,715 Pepsi or Lilt? 167 00:32:05,920 --> 00:32:07,831 Do you have any Tango? 168 00:32:07,920 --> 00:32:11,674 Actually, l did have a can of Tango somewhere. 169 00:32:11,760 --> 00:32:14,149 Quiet. That's an lnfected. 170 00:32:24,080 --> 00:32:25,832 They're in. Move! 171 00:32:28,800 --> 00:32:31,234 Wait up, Selena. 172 00:32:32,120 --> 00:32:34,350 Wait for me, please! 173 00:32:36,240 --> 00:32:38,470 - Wait for me. - Come on. 174 00:32:38,560 --> 00:32:40,471 - Run! - Wait! 175 00:32:41,080 --> 00:32:43,674 Please. For fuck's sake. 176 00:32:48,040 --> 00:32:51,271 Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move. 177 00:32:51,360 --> 00:32:53,351 Thank you. 178 00:33:05,320 --> 00:33:07,276 Open the door. 179 00:33:12,640 --> 00:33:14,153 Open the door. 180 00:33:18,680 --> 00:33:21,069 - Open up. - Where's Dad? 181 00:33:21,160 --> 00:33:22,559 What? 182 00:33:25,040 --> 00:33:27,918 - Open the fucking door. - Where's Dad? 183 00:33:28,000 --> 00:33:30,195 Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside. 184 00:33:37,800 --> 00:33:39,995 Go in. Go in. 185 00:33:57,280 --> 00:33:59,635 l'm Frank, anyway. 186 00:34:04,080 --> 00:34:07,470 Good to meet you. This is my daughter Hannah. 187 00:34:07,560 --> 00:34:09,710 Come on, sweetheart. Say hello. 188 00:34:11,080 --> 00:34:13,071 Come on. 189 00:34:15,760 --> 00:34:17,591 This is great. Just great. 190 00:34:19,840 --> 00:34:22,035 Calls for a celebration, l'd say. 191 00:34:22,120 --> 00:34:25,032 Why don't you all sit down and... 192 00:34:25,120 --> 00:34:27,953 Hannah, what have we got to offer? 193 00:34:28,040 --> 00:34:30,429 We've got Mum's crème de menthe. 194 00:34:30,520 --> 00:34:33,114 Great. Crème de menthe. 195 00:34:33,200 --> 00:34:35,794 Yeah. Sit, please. 196 00:34:35,880 --> 00:34:38,235 Get comfortable. 197 00:34:40,960 --> 00:34:43,838 - Where are the bloody glasses? - Middle cupboard. 198 00:34:43,920 --> 00:34:46,673 Nah, the good ones. lt's a celebration. 199 00:34:46,760 --> 00:34:49,149 Top cupboard. 200 00:34:49,240 --> 00:34:51,834 So this is your place? 201 00:34:53,040 --> 00:34:54,712 lt's nice. 202 00:35:08,520 --> 00:35:11,478 l know it isn't much, but cheers. 203 00:35:11,560 --> 00:35:13,232 Cheers. 204 00:35:33,880 --> 00:35:35,871 You OK in there? 205 00:35:36,800 --> 00:35:39,030 Yeah. 206 00:35:39,120 --> 00:35:44,478 Sorry we couldn't spare the water. Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work. 207 00:35:46,080 --> 00:35:48,230 You'll have to use the bucket. 208 00:35:54,520 --> 00:35:57,034 Have to empty it each morning. 209 00:35:57,120 --> 00:36:00,635 Just chuck it over the balcony. No mod cons here. 210 00:36:00,720 --> 00:36:02,358 lt's fine. 211 00:36:02,440 --> 00:36:05,432 Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in. 212 00:36:07,040 --> 00:36:09,315 We have a spare room. 213 00:36:11,640 --> 00:36:14,108 Are you and Selena...? 214 00:36:18,240 --> 00:36:20,515 l'll take the living room. lt's fine. 215 00:36:20,600 --> 00:36:22,397 Right. 216 00:36:23,240 --> 00:36:25,231 No, l mean, yeah. 217 00:36:29,160 --> 00:36:32,038 - Goodnight, then. - Goodnight, Frank. 218 00:36:46,080 --> 00:36:47,559 Very spruce. 219 00:36:48,840 --> 00:36:51,149 Very shredded. 220 00:36:55,720 --> 00:36:59,269 - So what do you make of them? - They're desperate. 221 00:37:00,360 --> 00:37:03,079 Probably need us more than we need them. 222 00:37:04,480 --> 00:37:06,630 l think they're good people. 223 00:37:09,360 --> 00:37:12,193 - Good people? - Yeah. 224 00:37:13,920 --> 00:37:18,391 You should be more concerned about whether they're gonna slow you down. 225 00:37:18,480 --> 00:37:22,075 - Because if they slowed you down... - l'd leave them behind. 226 00:37:22,160 --> 00:37:23,991 - ln a heartbeat. - Yeah. 227 00:37:24,680 --> 00:37:26,272 l wouldn't. 228 00:37:26,360 --> 00:37:29,750 Then you're gonna wind up getting yourself killed. 229 00:37:37,760 --> 00:37:40,149 l'm gonna get some sleep. 230 00:37:45,160 --> 00:37:48,277 You think l don't get it, but l do get it. 231 00:37:50,080 --> 00:37:53,914 And l know l'd be dead already if l hadn't met you. 232 00:37:54,400 --> 00:37:55,913 Sure. 233 00:37:56,000 --> 00:37:57,513 No, look. 234 00:37:59,800 --> 00:38:01,791 l mean, thank you. 235 00:38:04,840 --> 00:38:06,910 And l mean, sure. 236 00:38:07,000 --> 00:38:09,673 Goodnight, Jim. 237 00:38:09,760 --> 00:38:11,751 Goodnight. 238 00:38:24,800 --> 00:38:26,791 We lost water pressure three weeks ago. 239 00:38:26,880 --> 00:38:30,839 l thought we'd be OK with the water from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks. 240 00:38:30,920 --> 00:38:33,992 But it vanishes so quick you wouldn't believe. 241 00:38:37,160 --> 00:38:38,798 You drink it, 242 00:38:38,880 --> 00:38:40,598 it evaporates, 243 00:38:40,680 --> 00:38:42,671 turns stagnant. 244 00:38:44,960 --> 00:38:46,951 They're all empty. 245 00:38:47,800 --> 00:38:49,711 Hasn't rained in ten days. 246 00:38:49,800 --> 00:38:53,873 You can set up a plastic sheet to catch dew and condensation. 247 00:38:53,960 --> 00:38:57,555 Saw it on TV once, but l can't make it work. 248 00:38:58,840 --> 00:39:00,831 You'd never think it. 249 00:39:01,720 --> 00:39:04,553 Needing rain so badly. 250 00:39:06,160 --> 00:39:08,469 Not in fucking England. 251 00:39:12,960 --> 00:39:15,952 We're not going to be able to stay here. 252 00:39:24,520 --> 00:39:28,115 - There's been no broadcasts for weeks. - Just listen. 253 00:39:28,200 --> 00:39:32,591 Salvation is here. The answer to lnfection is here. 254 00:39:32,680 --> 00:39:35,558 lf you can hear this, you're not alone. 255 00:39:35,640 --> 00:39:39,952 There are others like you. There are other survivors. 256 00:39:40,040 --> 00:39:42,156 We are soldiers and we are armed. 257 00:39:42,240 --> 00:39:45,391 Oh, my God. Soldiers. 258 00:39:45,480 --> 00:39:49,871 - Quiet. There's more. - Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602, 259 00:39:49,960 --> 00:39:53,236 27 miles northeast of Manchester. 260 00:39:53,320 --> 00:39:57,074 - You must find us. Salvation is... - Now itjust repeats. 261 00:39:57,160 --> 00:39:59,435 - lt's a recording? - Yeah. 262 00:39:59,520 --> 00:40:02,318 But this is where it's telling us to go. 263 00:40:02,400 --> 00:40:04,470 Just there. 264 00:40:05,920 --> 00:40:10,516 The way things are, we might need two or three days to get up there. 265 00:40:10,600 --> 00:40:12,238 ''We''? 266 00:40:16,160 --> 00:40:21,996 Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah do need you more than you need us. 267 00:40:22,080 --> 00:40:25,117 - l didn't... - lt's OK. lt's the truth. 268 00:40:25,200 --> 00:40:27,589 l can't leave the block if it's the two of us. 269 00:40:27,680 --> 00:40:31,468 Something might happen to me. Hannah'd be alone. l couldn't risk it. 270 00:40:31,560 --> 00:40:33,198 But with other people... 271 00:40:33,280 --> 00:40:37,398 lf it's a recording, the soldiers who made it could be dead. 272 00:40:37,480 --> 00:40:40,836 - lt's possible. - That stuff about the answer to lnfection. 273 00:40:40,920 --> 00:40:45,038 There is no answer. lt's already done all the damage it can. 274 00:40:45,120 --> 00:40:47,839 - Maybe they have a cure. - Maybe they've got nothing. 275 00:40:47,920 --> 00:40:51,833 - The only way to find out is to reach them. - We could die trying. 276 00:40:53,840 --> 00:40:56,035 Or die here. 277 00:40:56,120 --> 00:41:01,592 Anyway, it isn't true what Dad said. You need us just the same as we need you. 278 00:41:03,040 --> 00:41:04,837 We need each other. 279 00:41:04,920 --> 00:41:09,994 And we'll never be safe in the cities. The soldiers could keep us safe. 280 00:41:10,680 --> 00:41:12,671 We have to try and get there. 281 00:41:13,760 --> 00:41:15,273 Get there how? 282 00:41:26,240 --> 00:41:29,835 Just so you know, l don't take cheques or credit cards. 283 00:41:57,240 --> 00:42:00,118 - What do you think? - lt's the most direct route. 284 00:42:00,200 --> 00:42:05,228 Then we should take the indirect route. The one in daylight and not underground. 285 00:42:05,320 --> 00:42:07,550 Let's just get it done. 286 00:42:22,120 --> 00:42:24,509 No. See, this is a really shit idea. 287 00:42:25,360 --> 00:42:28,591 You know why? Because it's obviously a shit idea. 288 00:42:28,680 --> 00:42:32,878 We're gonna drive into the tunnel full of fucking smashed cars. 289 00:42:32,960 --> 00:42:35,758 lt's really fucking obviously a shit idea. 290 00:42:35,840 --> 00:42:37,990 Hold on. 291 00:42:46,800 --> 00:42:48,597 Dad! 292 00:43:07,240 --> 00:43:08,719 Fuck. 293 00:43:09,960 --> 00:43:12,269 The world's worst place to get a flat. 294 00:43:12,360 --> 00:43:15,557 Agreed. l think we'd better do this quick. 295 00:43:17,960 --> 00:43:20,030 l've got the wheel. You're on the jack. 296 00:43:34,040 --> 00:43:37,430 Do you hear that?
